intro: Zyrphelis foliosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf zyrphelis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. Zyrphelis foliosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for horticultural collections in warm climates.
